detected_issues.description: High-dose Statin (Simvastatin 80mg) + Macrolide antibiotic (Clarithromycin) - rhabdomyolysis risk
detected_issues.reasoning: Patient on Simvastatin 80mg daily prescribed Clarithromycin 500mg BID. Clarithromycin is a strong CYP3A4 inhibitor that dramatically increases simvastatin serum levels. High-dose simvastatin (80mg) with CYP3A4 inhibitor causes rhabdomyolysis - severe muscle breakdown with myoglobinuria, acute kidney injury, potentially fatal outcome. FDA Black Box Warning specifically contraindicates this combination. Should use azithromycin or doxycycline instead.
